titleStmt.title: The state of Dublin, as it stood the 27. of December, and of other parts of Ireland. Being the copy of a letter sent from a good hand to an alderman of this city. By reading which you will finde the vanity and falshood of those vaine foolish pamphlets invented and published of late. With a strange and unheard of flocking together of severall kinde of birds over the city of Dublin on Christmas eve last.
titleStmt.author: Whetcombe, Tristram.

notesStmt.note: A good hand = Tristram Whetcombe, who has signed end of text: T.W.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
